org.svvrl.goal.core.aut.fsa
Class InputTester

java.lang.Object
  org.svvrl.goal.core.aut.fsa.InputTester

public class InputTester
extends java.lang.Object

An InputTester tests if an input sequence is accepted by an automaton or not.

Author:
Ming-Hsien Tsai

Nested Class Summary
(package private) static class InputTester.AcceptingRunFinder
          This class is used to traverse a configuration automaton C of an automaton A to find a lasso of C such that the corresponding lasso of A is accepting.
static class InputTester.Result
          This class defines the result of an input test.

Method Detail

isAccepted

public static InputTester.Result isAccepted(FSA aut,
                                            java.lang.String input)
                                     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Checks if an input sequence represented by a string is accepted by a finite state automaton.

Parameters:
aut - a finite state automaton
input - a string representing an input sequence
Returns:
the result of the input test
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the input string is invalid
See Also:
InputSequence

isAccepted

public static InputTester.Result isAccepted(FSA aut,
                                            InputSequence seq)
Checks if an input sequence is accepted by a finite state automaton.

Parameters:
aut - a finite state automaton
seq - an input sequence
Returns:
the result of the input test
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if (1) the input sequence contains symbols that are not in the alphabet of aut, (2) aut is an NFW but seq is an infinite input sequence, or (3) the acceptance condition of aut is not on states.
